meanings.definition: The state or quality of being thick, sticky, and semi-fluid in consistency.
meanings.sent1: The viscousness of the honey made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent2: The syrup's viscousness made it perfect for coating pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The viscousness of the slime toy entertained the kids for hours.
meanings.sent4: The viscousness of the mud seemed to slow down time itself.
meanings.sent5: The viscousness of the glue held the broken pieces together firmly.

meanings.definition: The property of a fluid that resists flow.
meanings.sent1: The viscousness of the oil in the engine helped lubricate the parts.
meanings.sent2: The viscousness of the shampoo made it hard to rinse out of my hair.
meanings.sent3: The viscousness of the ketchup made squirting it out a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The viscousness of time seemed to slow down as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The viscousness of the molasses made it flow like a lazy river.
